content:
I am an Assistant Professor of Economics in the Department of Economics at the Shippensburg University of Pennsylvania.
I am an applied economist specializing in three unique research domains: healthcare provider labor/licensing markets, the opioid epidemic, and, recently, entrepreneurship.
I use various applied econometric, spatial, policy evaluation techniques, and causal analyses to understand how policy changes affect the labor market and health outcomes. In addition, I supplement my empirical knowledge with the practice of technology-driven methods such as data-scrapping, big data, predictive, and causal machine learning approaches.
I have published in numerous academic journals, including the World Development, Annals of Regional Science, and Energy Economics.
My broader goal is to understand the health care market in the USA, various consequences of health policies, and labor market regulation.
I am teaching Microeconomics in summer 2022 and Principles of Economics in Fall 2022. In addition, I have taught Regional Economics, Economic Analysis of Big Data, Principles of Economics, Principles of Macroeconomics, Managerial Economics, Business Data Visualization, and Elementary Business & Economic Statistics.
For any questions about my research or other scholarly activities, please contact me by email sshakya@ship.edu. You can also reach me on Twitter @econshishir.

title: Shishir Shakya
